008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.HashSet;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016import java.util.LinkedList;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
021import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
022
023/**
024 * Abstract class representing a tree of extremal image components.
025 * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
026 */
027public abstract class ComponentTree<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
028        
029        /**
030         * The method (algorithm) for building the component tree.
031         */
032        public enum Method {
033                /** Specifies the classic (global immersion) algorithm. */
034                GlobalImmersion,
035                /** Specifies the linear-time algorithm. */
036                LinearTime;
037        }
038        
039        // --------------------------------------------------------------
040        
041        /**
042         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image using the
043         * default method ({@link Method#LinearTime}).
044         * @param <T> the generic node type
045         * @param ip the input image
046         * @return the component tree for the specified image
047         */
048        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip) {
049                return from(ip, Method.LinearTime);
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image.
054         * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
055         * @param ip the input (gray-level) image
056         * @param method the method for building the component tree
057         * @return the component tree
058         */
059        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip, Method method) {
060                return from(new PixelMap(ip), method);
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Creates a new component tree for the specified {@link PixelMap}.
065         * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
066         * @param pm a {@link PixelMap} instance
067         * @param method the method for building the component tree
068         * @return the component tree
069         */
070        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(PixelMap pm, Method method) {
071                switch (method) {
072                case LinearTime:  return new ComponentTreeLinearTime<>(pm);
073                case GlobalImmersion: return new ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<>(pm);
074                }
075                return null;
076        }
077        
078        // --------------------------------------------------------------
079
080        /**
081         * Returns the root component of this component tree.
082         * @return the root component
083         */
084        public abstract Component<T> getRoot();
085
086        /**
087         * Returns an unordered collection of all tree components.
088         * @return all tree components
089         */
090        public abstract Collection<Component<T>> getComponents();
091        
092        @Override
093        public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
094                return getComponents().iterator();
095        }
096        
097        /**
098         * Finds and returns a collection of all leaf components of this tree.
099         * A leaf is a component which has no children.
100         * @return all leaf components
101         */
102        public Collection<Component<T>> getLeaves() {
103                Collection<Component<T>> leaves = new LinkedList<>();
104                for (Component<T> c : getComponents()) {
105                        if (c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {
106                                leaves.add(c);
107                        }
108                }       
109                return leaves;
110        }
111        
112        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
113        
114        /**
115         * Component tree integrity checks.
116         * @return true iff all checks are passed
117         */
118        public boolean validate() {
119                if (!checkNodes()) {
120                        System.out.println("checkNodes failed");
121                        return false;
122                }
123                if (!checkParents()) {
124                        System.out.println("checkParents failed");
125                        return false;
126                }
127                if (!checkChildren()) {
128                        System.out.println("checkChildren failed");
129                        return false;
130                }
131                if (!checkRoot()) {
132                        System.out.println("checkRoot failed");
133                        return false;
134                }
135                if (!checkLevels()) {
136                        System.out.println("checkLevels failed");
137                        return false;
138                }
139                if (!checkSize()) {
140                        System.out.println("checkSize failed");
141                        return false;
142                }
143                return true;
144        }
145        
146        
147        /**
148         * Checks if all tree nodes reachable through root are contained in components list
149         * and the tree has no duplicate nodes (and no cycles).
150         * @return true iff OK
151         */
152        boolean checkNodes() {
153                Set<Component<T>> componentSet = new HashSet<>(); // empty hash set
154                int duplicateID = traverse(getRoot(), componentSet);
155                if (duplicateID >= 0) {         // traverse() registers all visited components
156                        System.out.println("*** component tree has duplicate node: " + duplicateID);
157                        return false;
158                }
159                if (getComponents().size() != componentSet.size()) {
160                        System.out.println("*** some nodes in components list can not be reached!");
161                        return false;
162                }
163                return true;
164        }
165        
166        int traverse(Component<T> c, Set<Component<T>> cS) {
167                if (cS.add(c)) {
168                        for (Component<T> cc : c.getChildren()) {
169                                int duplicateId = traverse(cc, cS);
170                                if (duplicateId >= 0) { // duplicate node
171                                        return duplicateId;
172                                };
173                        }
174                        return -1;      // everything OK, no duplicate node
175                }
176                else {  // c was already in set
177                        System.out.println("*** duplicate tree node: " + c.ID);
178                        return c.ID;
179                }
180        }
181
182        /**
183         * Checks if all parent relations are consistent.
184         * @return true iff OK
185         */
186        boolean checkParents() {
187                Collection<Component<T>> comps = getComponents();
188                HashSet<Component<T>> compsH = new HashSet<>(comps); // to improve lookup speed
189                
190                for (Component<?> c : comps) {
191                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
192                        if (p == null) {
193                                continue;
194                        }
195                        
196                        // check if parent is listed in 'components' (use HashSet for speed)
197                        if (!compsH.contains(p)) {
198                                System.out.println("*** component not contained in components list: " + c.ID);
199                                return false;
200                        }
201                                                
202                        // check if parent is not c itself
203                        if (p == c) {
204                                System.out.println("*** self-referring parent link in component " + c.ID);
205                                return false;
206                        }                               
207                }
208                return true;
209        }
210        
211        /**
212         * Checks if all child relations are consistent.
213         * @return true iff OK
214         */
215        boolean checkChildren() {
216                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
217                        // check if children is a list (not null)
218                        if (c.getChildren() == null) {
219                                System.out.println("*** children is null (not an empty list) in component " + c.ID);
220                                return false;
221                        }
222                        
223                        // check if all children of c have c as parent
224                        for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
225                                // check if c is parent of its child:
226                                if (child.getParent() != c) {
227                                        System.out.println("*** incorrect parent link in component " + child.ID);
228                                        return false;
229                                }
230                        }       
231                }
232                return true;
233        }
234        /** 
235         * Checks if the tree has a unique root.
236         * @return true iff OK
237         */
238        boolean checkRoot() {
239                // check if a single root exists and is properly marked (with null parent)
240                int rootcnt = 0;
241                Component<T> root = getRoot();
242                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
243                        if (c.getParent() == null) {
244                                rootcnt++;
245                                if (c != root) {
246                                        System.out.println("*** found non-root node without parent: " + c.ID);
247                                        return false;
248                                }
249                        }
250                }
251                if (rootcnt > 1) {
252                        System.out.println("*** found multiple roots: " + rootcnt);
253                        return false;
254                }
255                return true;
256        }
257        
258        /**
259         * Checks if all local pixels of have the same value as {@link #level}.
260         * @return true iff OK
261         */
262        boolean checkLevels() {
263                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
264                        int lc = c.getLevel();
265                        
266                        // check if parent's level is greater than this component's level:
267                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
268                        if (p != null) {
269                                int lp = p.getLevel();
270                                if (lc >= lp) { // must be lc < lp
271                                        System.out.println("*** value lc >= lp for component " + c.ID);
272                                }
273                        }
274                        
275                        // check if all local points have the same level as this component's level:
276                        for (Pixel x : c.getLocalPixels()) {
277                                if (x.val != lc) {
278                                        System.out.println("*** local pixel with wrong value in component " + c.ID);
279                                        return false;
280                                }
281                        }
282                }
283                return true;
284        }
285        
286        /**
287         * Checks if the size of each component is the same as the number of
288         * local pixels plus the combined size of all children.
289         * @return true iff OK
290         */
291        boolean checkSize() {
292                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
293                        int csize = c.getLocalPixels().size();
294                        for (Component<?> cc : c.getChildren()) {
295                                csize = csize + cc.getSize();
296                        }
297                        if (csize != c.getSize()) {
298                                System.out.println("*** wrong size in component " + c.ID);
299                                return false;
300                        }
301                }
302                return true;
303        }
304        
305        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
306        
307        @Override
308        public String toString() { 
309                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
310                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
311                this.printToStream(ps);
312                return os.toString();
313        }
314        
315        private void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
316                strm.print(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": ");
317                strm.format("   number of components: %d\n", getComponents().size());
318                for (Component<?> r : getComponents()) {
319                        r.printToStream(strm);
320                        strm.println();
321                }
322                strm.println("root = " + getRoot());
323        }
324
325}
